plugins.name: Change Variable Descriptions
plugins.description:
Tired of manually updating each Figma variable’s description? This plugin streamlines the process by allowing you to update all variable descriptions simultaneously using a CSV file. This means you can ensure your design system stays consistent and well-documented—without the hassle of repetitive edits.


How It Works:


•Prepare Your CSV: Create a CSV file with the format: token_name,description. Ensure each variable name in your CSV matches exactly (1:1) with the ones in Figma; the plugin is sensitive to misspellings and will skip any mismatches.

•Select Variable Collection(s): Choose one or multiple variable collections based on your CSV file. (Recommendation: create a separate CSV for each collection.)

•Preview Changes: Review the highlighted changes in a table before applying them, ensuring accuracy and control over the update process.

•Apply Updates: With just a few clicks, update all selected variable descriptions in your Figma design system.


Streamline your design documentation, avoid manual errors, and keep your design tokens up-to-date effortlessly!
plugins.tagline: Simplify workflow: Update variable descriptions in one click

plugins.name: Quick styles
plugins.description:
How does the plugin works:


Save a Style

1.Open the plugin library.

2.Select the layer you want to save styles from.

3.Click Save on one of the style slots in the plugin.

4.The style is saved!


Set a Shortcut

1.Open System Settings.

2.Navigate to Keyboard > Keyboard Shortcuts > App Shortcuts.

3.Click on the plus (+) icon.

4.Set the app to Figma in the menu.

5.Type the exact menu title name.

6.Set your shortcut and click Done!


Apply a Style

1.Select any layer.

2.Use the menu item or shortcut to apply styles!

plugins.name: Frame Flow
plugins.description:
The Figma plugin “Frame Flow” allows you to duplicate the selected frame to the right or below with a predefined spacing. In addition to duplication, it also lets you insert blank frames at custom intervals. It’s especially useful when creating presentation documents, as it helps you add pages smoothly without disrupting the layout spacing. Setting up keyboard shortcuts is highly recommended for efficient use.


New Frame

Creates a new empty frame with the specified size.


Add Frame Right

Creates a new empty frame with the specified size to the right of the currently selected frame.

Recommended shortcut: ⌘ + ⌥ (Option) + → (Right Arrow)


Add Frame Below

Creates a new empty frame with the specified size below the currently selected frame.

Recommended shortcut: ⌘ + ⌥ (Option) + ↓ (Down Arrow)


Duplicate Frame Right

Duplicates the currently selected frame to the right.

Recommended shortcut: ⌘ + ⌥ (Option) + ⇧ (Shift) + → (Right Arrow)


Duplicate Frame Below

Duplicates the currently selected frame below.

Recommended shortcut: ⌘ + ⌥ (Option) + ⇧ (Shift) + ↓ (Down Arrow)


Settings

Configure various parameters.




Figmaプラグイン「Frame Flow」は、選択中のフレームを、事前に設定した間隔で右隣や下に複製できるプラグインです。複製のみではなく、白紙のフレームを好きな間隔で配置することも可能です。主に資料作成時、ページの間隔を崩さずスムーズにページを増やしていきたい時に活躍します。ショートカットを設定するのがおすすめです。


New Frame

設定したサイズの空フレームを新規作成します。


Add Frame Right

いま選択しているフレームの右隣に、設定したサイズの空フレームを新規作成します。おすすめショートカットキーは⌘ + ⌥(option) + →(右矢印)です。


Add Frame Below

いま選択しているフレームの下に、設定したサイズの空フレームを新規作成します。おすすめショートカットキーは⌘ + ⌥(option) + ↓(下矢印)です。


Duplicate Frame Right

いま選択しているフレームの右隣に、フレームを複製します。

おすすめショートカットキーは⌘ + ⌥(option) + ⇧(shift) + →(右矢印)です。


Duplicate Frame Below

いま選択しているフレームの下に、フレームを複製します。

おすすめショートカットキーは⌘ + ⌥(option) + ⇧(shift) + ↓(下矢印)です。


Settings

様々な値を設定します。
plugins.tagline: Quickly layout 1920x1080 frames

plugins.name: TextSwapper
plugins.description:
Features


Easily customize text for legal contracts, sales proposals, and resumes in Figma.

Quickly update text without needing extra tools.

Streamlined text replacement for multiple objects, components, and frames.

Simple and intuitive interface for seamless integration with your workflow.

Save time ⏰ and eliminate the hassle of manually editing text in Figma!

How:


Add the word "page" to the name of your page frame (e.g., agreement_page).

Enter the text you want to replace in the "Find text" field (e.g., {company name}).

Enter the new text in the "Replace with" field (e.g., Figma).

Use the "Update" button to replace the specified line, or the "Update All" button to replace all occurrences of the text in your document.

Use the + and - buttons to adjust the number of text fields.

Click Save to store your list of text replacements for faster updates when working on the same document.

Use Load to retrieve your saved list of text replacements and automatically fill in the fields. The current version retrieves only the latest saved list.

Click Download Selected Pages as PDF to download the selected pages as one merged PDF file.
plugins.tagline: Easily customize text for legal contracts, sales proposals, and resumes—no extra tools needed.

plugins.name: md格式转设计稿 Markdown to Frame
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin allows users to convert Markdown text into fully structured Figma frames automatically, enhancing design workflows and documentation processes.


Function Description

The plugin parses Markdown syntax and creates corresponding Figma frames and text elements, supporting headings, lists, bold text, and horizontal rules. It ensures that all content is visually organized according to Markdown structuring.


Usage Method

Simply input your Markdown text into the provided text area in the plugin’s UI and click the ‘Convert Markdown’ button. The formatted content will appear as structured frames within your current Figma file.


Note

Ensure all text is properly formatted in Markdown before conversion. The frame width is fixed at 500px, but the height will adjust according to the content.


介绍

此插件允许用户将Markdown文本自动转换成完全结构化的Figma框架，增强设计工作流程和文档处理过程。


功能说明

插件解析Markdown语法，并创建相应的Figma框架和文本元素，支持标题、列表、加粗文本和水平规则。它确保所有内容都按照Markdown的结构进行视觉组织。


使用方法

只需在插件的用户界面中提供的文本区域中输入您的Markdown文本，然后点击“转换Markdown”按钮。格式化的内容将以结构化框架的形式出现在您当前的Figma文件中。


注意事项

确保在转换前所有文本都正确格式化为Markdown。框架宽度固定为500px，但高度将根据内容调整。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Transform Markdown into Structured Figma Frames

plugins.name: batchy
plugins.description:
batchy is a helper tool to make your exports more comfortable. Instead of just using the layer name and getting the layer size, you will now be able to write your own asset name dynamically with the help of export tokens and choosing between layer size or screen size for your assets.


Features

  1. dynamic asset names with several export tokens like: layers, date, file, scaling, index, user, top-level frame name,
  2. export assets in layer or screen size (top-level frame)
  3. export your current selection
  4. export from an asset list
  5. date formats for your naming
  6. export in common file formats like png, jpg, svg, pdf
  7. multiple files will be downloaded as a zip, single files will be downloaded as single files
  8. OS-proofed asset name support
plugins.tagline: Export your designs with dynamic name behaviors.

  2. export assets in layer or screen size (top-level frame)
  3. export your current selection
  4. export from an asset list
  5. date formats for your naming
  6. export in common file formats like png, jpg, svg, pdf
  7. multiple files will be downloaded as a zip, single files will be downloaded as single files
  8. OS-proofed asset name support
123462.release_notes:
v1.2.2

**Bug fixes**
🪲 top-level frame export fixed
🪲 there was an issue when using the same token multiple times

**Additional changes**
✅ tokens now use a $ in the beginning instead of curly brackets in the beginning and the end. Example {{file}} --> $file
✅ $layerName token is now called $layer
✅ $userName token is now called $user
123462.tagline: Export your designs with dynamic name behaviors.

plugins.name: Figma Recall
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you save, manage, and switch between different versions (iterations) of your Figma frames.


Save an Iteration: Select a frame and click the Save button to save its current state.


Save with a Note: Hold Ctrl/Cmd and click the Save button to add a text description to your saved iteration.


Recall All Iterations: Select a frame and click the Recall button to view all its saved versions side-by-side.


Update Iterations: Make changes in the recalled container frame for any version and click Save to update with your changes in the stored master versions.


Navigate Versions: Use the < and > arrow buttons to cycle through saved iterations directly on your canvas.


Delete All Iterations: Select a frame and click the Delete button (trash icon) to remove all its saved versions.


Rename Iterations: Right-click the Save button to rename the selected frame and its entire group of saved iterations.
plugins.tagline: Version History but for Each Frame

plugins.name: Scout : Your Design System Auditor
plugins.description:
Scout: Your Design System Auditor

Ever felt like your design tokens are playing hide-and-seek? 🕵️‍♀️ Meet Scout, your trusty design detective—ready to sniff out sneaky inconsistencies and bring harmony back to your Figma universe!


Scout swiftly audits your Figma files, uncovering rogue color hexes and typography rebels that forgot their tokens at home. No more developer handoff blues or "Oops, missed that!" moments. 🎯


Superpowers:

Color Detective: Catches color chaos quicker than you can shout “Hex!”


Typography Sleuth: Spots font fugitives and sizes that went astray, keeping your design tight.


Smart Suggestions: Suggests spot-on tokens and handy fallbacks instantly—because who doesn't love instant magic? ✨


Theme-Agnostic: Works seamlessly with both light and dark themes, maintaining style consistency across all modes.


Local Variable & Style Support: Perfectly compatible with local variables and styles, ensuring complete design system integration.


Pinpoint Precision: Clearly tells you exactly where the issue is—no guessing games, just solutions!


How to Use Scout:


1. Feed Your Tokens: Connect Scout to your design system first—it'll securely save all your tokens locally.

2. Scan: Open Scout in any Figma file, select the frame you want to check, and hit "Scan."

3. Instant Results: Scout immediately highlights issues, suggests precise fixes, and ensures your designs stay token-perfect.


Scout is fun, quirky, and deadly accurate; a designer's best friend and a developer's dream come true. Let Scout do the heavy lifting and keep your designs perfectly polished. 


Get Scout today and give your design system the auditor it deserves.


Scout is currently in beta. Found bugs? Have questions, suggestions, or feature requests? 💌 DM me on Twitter

accepted.name: Satyam
accepted.description: Product and UI/UX Designer | Email me at sat02yam@gmail.com

plugins.name: Select by Style
plugins.description:
Select by Style makes it easy to find and select all elements on your page that share the same text or colour styling.


Perfect for designers who need to quickly audit styles, make bulk changes, or ensure consistency across their designs. Save time by selecting multiple elements at once instead of hunting them down individually.


What it does:

The plugin automatically scans your current page and organises all text styles and colour styles into easy-to-browse tables. Simply click on any style to instantly select all elements using that style across your page.


How to use it:

  1. Open the plugin to see all styles detected on your current page
  2. Browse the Text tab to see text styles with font details, sizes, and weights
  3. Browse the Colour tab to see colour styles with hex codes and opacity
  4. Use the search bar to quickly find specific styles by name, font, or colour
  5. Click any style row to select all elements using that style
  6. Use the Refresh button when you add new content to the page


Key features:

  1. Instant selection: Click once to select all elements with the same style
  2. Smart organisation: Separate tabs for text and colour styles with detailed information
  3. Search & filter: Quickly find styles by typing in the search box
  4. Library detection: See which styles are local vs. from external libraries
  5. Auto-refresh: Detects when you switch pages or add significant new content
  6. Live updates: Automatically updates when you change styles on selected elements


How are we doing? We're always working to make this plugin better and would genuinely appreciate hearing about your experience - and suggestions for enhancement.
plugins.tagline: Quickly select all elements using the same style

plugins.name: WCAG Contrast Auditor
plugins.description:
WCAG Contrast Auditor is a Figma plugin that helps you guarantee your text meets WCAG accessibility standards—no manual math or guesswork required. Simply:


  1. Select the text layers you want to check (or select a parent frame to audit everything inside).
  2. Pick your background color and target WCAG level (AA or AAA).
  3. Run Audit to instantly see how many layers pass or fail the chosen contrast threshold.


Key benefits:

  1. Automated compliance checks: Scan dozens or hundreds of text layers in seconds.
  2. Flexible thresholds: Choose between WCAG AA (4.5:1) or AAA (7:1) contrast ratios.
  3. Lightweight & zero setup: No external dependencies—just install and go.
  4. Actionable results: Get a quick pass/fail count so you know exactly where to focus your fixes.


Whether you’re building design systems, client deliverables, or internal UIs, WCAG Contrast Auditor makes accessibility a seamless, one-click step in your workflow. Ensure every color combination is compliant—and ship more inclusive products today!
plugins.tagline: Spot & Fix WCAG Contrast Issues Instantly.

plugins.name: Pseudo Localizer for Figma & FigJam
plugins.description:
Design global-ready UIs—without ever leaving Figma.


Skip the guesswork and see how your designs hold up in other languages, scripts, and text directions—instantly. With Pseudo Localizer, you can preview localized versions of your UI in seconds, directly inside Figma or FigJam. No setup, no logins, no external tools. Just you and your design.


ℹ️ What you can do with Pseudo Localizer:


✅ Preview global scripts instantly

Toggle between Latin, Cyrillic, CJK, and Arabic (RTL) with a single click.


✅ Test layout resilience

Stretch or shrink text length from –50% to +50% to spot issues like clipping, wrapping, or misalignment.


✅ Control the scope

Run it on a single button, a card, or the whole page—your call.


✅ Keep it private & fast

Everything happens on your machine. No accounts, no external servers, no privacy worries.


❗️Why it matters:


  1. Catch layout issues before they become bugs.
  2. Give your QA and localization teams better previews.
  3. Design smarter for a global audience—right from the start.


⚙️ How it works:


  1. Select your screens with text layers (or don't select anything to pseudo translate the full page).
  2. Pick your script and text expansion.
  3. Click "Pseudotranslate"—done! A new page appears with your mocked-up, localized content (including RTL adjustments).


✨ Ready to build for every language?

Install Pseudo Localizer from the Figma Community and see how your designs hold up across the globe.


📨 Got feedback? Share it here!

accepted.name: José Jóvena Casañ
accepted.description:

Big on UX, localization, and making things clear across cultures.
Rookie Figma Plugin Author.

plugins.name: Lokki - Comments Export
plugins.description:
Description

A plugin that allows you to turn Figma comments into Jira tasks with a couple of clicks.


Key features

- Export comments to selected Jira project

- Filter comments

- Merge multiple comments into one.

- Turn comment into sub-issue of the existing Jira issue.


How to use

When you run the plugin, it offers a simple 3 step onboarding screen explaining how things work.

  1. During the first run, we'll ask you to connect your plugin with your Jira.
  2. Next you need to generate personal token that allows you access your comments. This is mandatory for plugins operation since Figma do not provide direct access to comments with figma plugin tools.
  3. Select Jira project that you will use as default. You can change it later.
  4. That's it. You can select comments and export them to the Jira.


Sidenote

This is our first-ever plugin on Figma, and while things might not be ideal all at once, we are happy to hear your feedback, questions, and suggestions at dev@lokki.tools

Webpage: https://lokki.tools


Data Security & Network access

Our plugin does not save any remote counterpart, it means your data is only stored on your computer, inside your Figma editor. This applies to all of your data, tokes and comments except user identifier related to the premium status and subscription info.


About

- Idea by Kseniia Pashkovska & Oleksandr Drobinin

- Implementation by Oleksandr Drobinin
plugins.tagline: Turn Figma comments into Jira tasks instantly

plugins.name: Detach Aliases
plugins.description:
Detach Aliases lets you resolve variable's aliased values from their sources. Easily detach a specific group of variables or all variables in a collection. You can target one mode at a time or all modes at once!


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  4. Detach


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering the path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input
  3. You will see all variables which are located in the path and would have aliases detached in the preview panel on the left


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  2. Detaching variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Break your collection aliases en masse!

plugins.name: Easy Task Prioritiser
plugins.description:
Easy Task Prioritiser Quickly organize and rank your tasks using two proven prioritization frameworks — right inside Figma.


✨ How It Works

🔢 Stack Ranking

Go to the Stack tab.

Enter your list of tasks.

Click Start Comparison to begin.

You’ll be shown two tasks at a time — choose which is more important.

Repeat until all tasks are compared and ranked.

In the end:

You'll get a clear, ranked list of tasks

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to bring the list into your Figma file


🧠 MoSCoW Prioritization

Switch to the MoSCoW tab.

Add your tasks.

For each task, select whether it’s a Must, Should, Could, or Won’t.

plugins.name: MoroccanMock
plugins.description:
Design layouts more efficiently by pulling text strings, images, and cultural assets from a unique Moroccan-inspired palette. "moroccanMock" lets you create custom Moroccan-themed content and share it with other Figma users. Collaboration has never been easier!


Content:

Browse or search content to find a collection of Moroccan-inspired text strings, images, and icons. Struggling to find the perfect content? You can create your own text and image assets by using Add.


Add:

Create text categories and populate them with your own text strings. You can also upload up to 20 PNGs or JPEGs to create image content. As a creator, you may choose to share it publicly or keep it private. When you create content, it is automatically pinned to the Home Screen for quick access (signed-in users only).


Customize Your Home Screen:

Optimize your workflow by pinning the content that you use most to your home screen. Apply 1-click access to any content type with the switch of a toggle (signed-in users only). Drag and drop items on your home screen to suit your preferences.


How to use moroccanMock:

Find content:

Access saved content from your Home Screen or navigate through the tabs to search or browse content. Pin it for ease of access to your home screen.


Applying text content:

Select one or more text layers in your design to apply strings individually or apply them all. Use the original order provided or choose an order from the drop-down menu.


Applying image content:

Select one or more image layers or frames in your design, then apply the images individually or apply them all in random order.


Applying icon content:

Browse the collection or use the search bar to find a Moroccan icon. Click on the icon or drag and drop it into your design. You can also adjust the icon size to scale as needed.


Creating text and image content:

Navigate to the Add tab, click Add, and select content type. Provide a Title relevant to your content. Set your content to Public or Private. See the terms and conditions regarding usage and rights.


Anwar Bahou

LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/bahouanwar
plugins.tagline: Bring Moroccan Culture to Your Designs – Instantly

plugins.name: ShadeSmith – AI Palette Generator
plugins.description:
ShadeSmith is a Figma plugin that helps designers and developers instantly create scalable color palettes from a single base color (500-level).

It automatically generates tints, shades, and tonal variations using intelligent color logic. Whether you’re working on a design system, branding kit, or just experimenting, ShadeSmith ensures visually consistent and WCAG-compliant palettes with every click.


✨ Features:

•Start from any hex/RGB/base color

•Instantly generate tints (100–400) and shades (600–900)

•Accessible contrast suggestions built-in

•Copy-ready output for Figma styles, Tailwind tokens, or CSS

•Customizable intensity and range sliders


Perfect for:

•Design systems

•Theming

•Light/dark mode variants

•Rapid prototyping

accepted.description: I am a design leader with demonstrated expertise and experience of leading and delivering new product innovation, forming strategic design directions.

plugins.name: GridVar | Quick Column Grid with Variables
plugins.description:
GridVar helps you create width-based column layout grids with linked variables for any frame width. It automatically generates a set of variables representing different column configurations, including gutters, so you can quickly adjust and find the perfect fit for nested layers.


✨ Key Features:

•Quick Setup: Easily create layout grids with variable-based configurations.

•Flexible Widths: Effortlessly switch between column setups to match your design needs.

•Time-Saving: Eliminate manual calculations and streamline your workflow.


📌 How It Works:

Generated variables are conveniently stored in the "GridVar" variable collection. You can find the column width variables under: [Grid Name]/Columns.


Perfect for designers looking to simplify layout grid handling and enhance their Figma workflow.
plugins.tagline: GridVar: Width-based Layout Grids with Variables
